title: Cult Gaia and Gap Reveal Holiday Collaboration
description: Gap has been on a collaboration roll: This year alone it embarked on partnerships with Dôen, Madhappy and Palace. Now, Los Angeles-based label Cult Gaia joins that roster. Their collaborative collection, launching Oct. 10, bridges Gap's expertise in essentials with Cult Gaia's sleek, ...Continue reading
author: Janelle Sessoms
excerpt: The 35-piece collection, featuring a range of winter-ready styles, launches on Oct. 10.
text: HomeNewsThe 35-piece collection, featuring a range of winter-ready styles, launches on Oct. 10.Photo: Louise and Maria Thornfeldt/Courtesy of GapGap has been on a collaboration roll: This year alone it embarked on partnerships with Dôen, Madhappy and Palace. Now, Los Angeles-based label Cult Gaia joins that roster.Their collaborative collection, launching Oct. 10, bridges Gap's expertise in essentials with Cult Gaia's sleek, modern aesthetic. The 35-piece lineup comes through with holiday-ready styles, including knit cardigans, a faux-fur coat, a cutout maxi dress, wool trench coats and chain-link-detailed slip dresses. Prices start at $35 and go up to $498."Reimagining Gap's classic icons through Cult Gaia's lens has been an amazing journey," Jasmin Larian Hekmat, founder and designer of Cult Gaia, said in a statement. "The collaboration brought together Gap's classics and everyday wearability with Cult Gaia's sculptural and artistic approach, merging our two distinct creative forces. Each piece in this collection is thoughtfully designed to inspire creativity, blending art and function in a way that feels unique and timeless."Photos: Louise and Maria Thornfeldt/Courtesy of GapMark Breitbard, President & CEO of Gap brand, added, "Every piece was created with intention, with a focus on fabrications, hardware and stitching. In July 2023, Gap Inc. appointed its new CEO Richard Dickson — formerly of Mattel — followed by new Executive Vice President and Creative Director Zac Posen. In a bid to reinvent itself, the brand continues to focus on buzzy campaigns (Tyla, Troye Sivan, Dapper Dan), fun collabs and unique celebrity placements (Da'Vine Joy Randolph at the 2024 Met Gala, Anne Hathaway's shoppable white shirt dress).Gap x Cult Gaia is available to shop online and in select Gap stores starting Thursday, Oct. 10 at 12:00 p.m. ET.Keep scrolling to see all the pieces from the Gap x Cult Gaia collaboration.Gap x Cult GaiaGap x Cult GaiaGap x Cult GaiaGap x Cult GaiaGap x Cult GaiaGap x Cult GaiaGap x Cult GaiaGap x Cult GaiaGap x Cult GaiaGap x Cult GaiaGap x Cult GaiaGap x Cult GaiaGap x Cult GaiaGap x Cult GaiaGap x Cult GaiaGap x Cult GaiaGap x Cult GaiaGap x Cult GaiaGap x Cult GaiaGap x Cult GaiaGap x Cult GaiaGap x Cult GaiaGap x Cult GaiaGap x Cult GaiaGap x Cult GaiaGap x Cult GaiaGap x Cult GaiaGap x Cult GaiaGap x Cult GaiaGap x Cult GaiaGap x Cult GaiaPlease note: Occasionally, we use affiliate links on our site. html:
• Home
  • News

The 35-piece collection, featuring a range of winter-ready styles, launches on Oct. 10.

Gap has been on a collaboration roll: This year alone it embarked on partnerships with Dôen, Madhappy and Palace. Now, Los Angeles-based label Cult Gaia joins that roster.

Their collaborative collection, launching Oct. 10, bridges Gap's expertise in essentials with Cult Gaia's sleek, modern aesthetic. The 35-piece lineup comes through with holiday-ready styles, including knit cardigans, a faux-fur coat, a cutout maxi dress, wool trench coats and chain-link-detailed slip dresses. Prices start at $35 and go up to $498.

"Reimagining Gap's classic icons through Cult Gaia's lens has been an amazing journey," Jasmin Larian Hekmat, founder and designer of Cult Gaia, said in a statement. "The collaboration brought together Gap's classics and everyday wearability with Cult Gaia's sculptural and artistic approach, merging our two distinct creative forces. Each piece in this collection is thoughtfully designed to inspire creativity, blending art and function in a way that feels unique and timeless."

Mark Breitbard, President & CEO of Gap brand, added, "Every piece was created with intention, with a focus on fabrications, hardware and stitching. We are delivering elevated designs and fresh fits that our customers can cherish forever."

Scroll to Continue

Recommended Articles

Accompanying the collection is a campaig, lensed by sisters Louise and Maria Thornfeldt and starring Tina Kunakey alongside Kristina Byerley, Kelly Lim, Irene Law and Christen Rhule.

This collaboration comes amidst Gap's compelling comeback journey, following years of uninspiring product, bad press and business troubles. In July 2023, Gap Inc. appointed its new CEO Richard Dickson — formerly of Mattel — followed by new Executive Vice President and Creative Director Zac Posen. In a bid to reinvent itself, the brand continues to focus on buzzy campaigns (Tyla, Troye Sivan, Dapper Dan), fun collabs and unique celebrity placements (Da'Vine Joy Randolph at the 2024 Met Gala, Anne Hathaway's shoppable white shirt dress).

Gap x Cult Gaia is available to shop online and in select Gap stores starting Thursday, Oct. 10 at 12:00 p.m. ET.

Keep scrolling to see all the pieces from the Gap x Cult Gaia collaboration.
